creation_date: Late Period (c. 664 BC - 310 BC), Dynasty 26 -Macedonian Dynasty
title: Statuette of Amun-Ra, Standing with Feathered Crown
description: This hollow cast, votive statuette depicts the Egyptian god, Amun-Ra, striding forward, his arms tightly clasped at his sides. He wears a divine beard and pleated kilt. On his head is the usual flat-topped crown with solar-disk and double plumes. Amun was the wife of Mut and father of Khons, who together made the Theban triad.
inscriptions: label on base: 233; on base in graphite: A
